member.name: T:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.CreateEnvironmentEC2Request
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateEnvironmentEC2 operation. Creates an AWS Cloud9 development environment, launches an Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instance, and then connects from the instance to the environment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.CreateEnvironmentEC2Request.AutomaticStopTimeMinutes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AutomaticStopTimeMinutes.
The number of minutes until the running instance is shut down after the environment has last been used.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.CreateEnvironmentEC2Request.ClientRequestToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientRequestToken.
A unique, case-sensitive string that helps AWS Cloud9 to ensure this operation completes no more than one time.
For more information, see Client Tokens in the Amazon EC2 API Reference.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.CreateEnvironmentEC2Request.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
The description of the environment to create.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.CreateEnvironmentEC2Request.InstanceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InstanceType.
The type of instance to connect to the environment (for example, t2.micro).

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.CreateEnvironmentEC2Request.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the environment to create.
This name is visible to other AWS IAM users in the same AWS account.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.CreateEnvironmentEC2Request.OwnerArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OwnerArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the environment owner. This ARN can be the ARN of any AWS IAM principal. If this value is not specified, the ARN defaults to this environment's creator.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.CreateEnvironmentEC2Request.SubnetId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SubnetId.
The ID of the subnet in Amazon VPC that AWS Cloud9 will use to communicate with the Amazon EC2 instance.

member.name: T:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.CreateEnvironmentEC2Response
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateEnvironmentEC2 operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.CreateEnvironmentEC2Response.EnvironmentId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EnvironmentId.
The ID of the environment that was created.

member.name: T:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.CreateEnvironmentMembershipRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateEnvironmentMembership operation. Adds an environment member to an AWS Cloud9 development environment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.CreateEnvironmentMembershipRequest.EnvironmentId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EnvironmentId.
The ID of the environment that contains the environment member you want to add.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.CreateEnvironmentMembershipRequest.Permissions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Permissions.
The type of environment member permissions you want to associate with this environment member. Available values include:
read-only: Has read-only access to the environment.
read-write: Has read-write access to the environment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.CreateEnvironmentMembershipRequest.UserArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the environment member you want to add.

member.name: T:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.CreateEnvironmentMembershipResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateEnvironmentMembership operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.CreateEnvironmentMembershipResponse.Membership
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Membership.
Information about the environment member that was added.

member.name: T:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.DeleteEnvironmentMembershipRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DeleteEnvironmentMembership operation. Deletes an environment member from an AWS Cloud9 development environment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.DeleteEnvironmentMembershipRequest.EnvironmentId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EnvironmentId.
The ID of the environment to delete the environment member from.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.DeleteEnvironmentMembershipRequest.UserArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the environment member to delete from the environment.

member.name: T:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.DeleteEnvironmentMembershipResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DeleteEnvironmentMembership operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.DeleteEnvironmentRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DeleteEnvironment operation. Deletes an AWS Cloud9 development environment. If an Amazon EC2 instance is connected to the environment, also terminates the instance.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.DeleteEnvironmentRequest.EnvironmentId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EnvironmentId.
The ID of the environment to delete.

member.name: T:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.DeleteEnvironmentResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DeleteEnvironment operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.DescribeEnvironmentMembershipsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DescribeEnvironmentMemberships operation. Gets information about environment members for an AWS Cloud9 development environment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.DescribeEnvironmentMembershipsRequest.EnvironmentId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EnvironmentId.
The ID of the environment to get environment member information about.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.DescribeEnvironmentMembershipsRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
The maximum number of environment members to get information about.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.DescribeEnvironmentMembershipsRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
During a previous call, if there are more than 25 items in the list, only the first 25 items are returned, along with a unique string called a next token. To get the next batch of items in the list, call this operation again, adding the next token to the call. To get all of the items in the list, keep calling this operation with each subsequent next token that is returned, until no more next tokens are returned.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.DescribeEnvironmentMembershipsRequest.Permissions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Permissions.
The type of environment member permissions to get information about. Available values include:
owner: Owns the environment.
read-only: Has read-only access to the environment.
read-write: Has read-write access to the environment.
If no value is specified, information about all environment members are returned.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.DescribeEnvironmentMembershipsRequest.UserArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an individual environment member to get information about. If no value is specified, information about all environment members are returned.

member.name: T:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.DescribeEnvironmentMembershipsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DescribeEnvironmentMemberships operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.DescribeEnvironmentMembershipsResponse.Memberships
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Memberships.
Information about the environment members for the environment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.DescribeEnvironmentMembershipsResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
If there are more than 25 items in the list, only the first 25 items are returned, along with a unique string called a next token. To get the next batch of items in the list, call this operation again, adding the next token to the call.

member.name: T:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.DescribeEnvironmentsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DescribeEnvironments operation. Gets information about AWS Cloud9 development environments.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.DescribeEnvironmentsRequest.EnvironmentIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EnvironmentIds.
The IDs of individual environments to get information about.

member.name: T:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.DescribeEnvironmentsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DescribeEnvironments operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.DescribeEnvironmentsResponse.Environments
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Environments.
Information about the environments that are returned.

member.name: T:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.DescribeEnvironmentStatusRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DescribeEnvironmentStatus operation. Gets status information for an AWS Cloud9 development environment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.DescribeEnvironmentStatusRequest.EnvironmentId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EnvironmentId.
The ID of the environment to get status information about.

member.name: T:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.DescribeEnvironmentStatusResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DescribeEnvironmentStatus operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.DescribeEnvironmentStatusResponse.Message
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Message.
Any informational message about the status of the environment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.DescribeEnvironmentStatusResponse.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The status of the environment. Available values include:
connecting: The environment is connecting.
creating: The environment is being created.
deleting: The environment is being deleted.
error: The environment is in an error state.
ready: The environment is ready.
stopped: The environment is stopped.
stopping: The environment is stopping.

member.name: T:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.Environment
member.summary: Information about an AWS Cloud9 development environment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.Environment.Arn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Arn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the environment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.Environment.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
The description for the environment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.Environment.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The ID of the environment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.Environment.Lifecycle
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Lifecycle.
The state of the environment in its creation or deletion lifecycle.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.Environment.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the environment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.Environment.OwnerArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OwnerArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the environment owner.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.Environment.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The type of environment. Valid values include the following:
ec2: An Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instance connects to the environment.
ssh: Your own server connects to the environment.

member.name: T:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.EnvironmentLifecycle
member.summary: Information about the current creation or deletion lifecycle state of an AWS Cloud9 development environment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.EnvironmentLifecycle.FailureResource
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FailureResource.
If the environment failed to delete, the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the related AWS resource.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.EnvironmentLifecycle.Reason
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Reason.
Any informational message about the lifecycle state of the environment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.EnvironmentLifecycle.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The current creation or deletion lifecycle state of the environment.
CREATED: The environment was successfully created.
DELETE_FAILED: The environment failed to delete.
DELETING: The environment is in the process of being deleted.

member.name: T:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.EnvironmentMember
member.summary: Information about an environment member for an AWS Cloud9 development environment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.EnvironmentMember.EnvironmentId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EnvironmentId.
The ID of the environment for the environment member.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.EnvironmentMember.LastAccess
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastAccess.
The time, expressed in epoch time format, when the environment member last opened the environment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.EnvironmentMember.Permissions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Permissions.
The type of environment member permissions associated with this environment member. Available values include:
owner: Owns the environment.
read-only: Has read-only access to the environment.
read-write: Has read-write access to the environment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.EnvironmentMember.UserArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the environment member.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.EnvironmentMember.UserId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserId.
The user ID in AWS Identity and Access Management (AWS IAM) of the environment member.

member.name: T:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.ListEnvironmentsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the ListEnvironments operation. Gets a list of AWS Cloud9 development environment identifiers.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.ListEnvironmentsRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
The maximum number of environments to get identifiers for.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.ListEnvironmentsRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
During a previous call, if there are more than 25 items in the list, only the first 25 items are returned, along with a unique string called a next token. To get the next batch of items in the list, call this operation again, adding the next token to the call. To get all of the items in the list, keep calling this operation with each subsequent next token that is returned, until no more next tokens are returned.

member.name: T:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.ListEnvironmentsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the ListEnvironments operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.ListEnvironmentsResponse.EnvironmentIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EnvironmentIds.
The list of environment identifiers.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.ListEnvironmentsResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
If there are more than 25 items in the list, only the first 25 items are returned, along with a unique string called a next token. To get the next batch of items in the list, call this operation again, adding the next token to the call.

member.name: T:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.UpdateEnvironmentMembershipRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the UpdateEnvironmentMembership operation. Changes the settings of an existing environment member for an AWS Cloud9 development environment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.UpdateEnvironmentMembershipRequest.EnvironmentId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EnvironmentId.
The ID of the environment for the environment member whose settings you want to change.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.UpdateEnvironmentMembershipRequest.Permissions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Permissions.
The replacement type of environment member permissions you want to associate with this environment member. Available values include:
read-only: Has read-only access to the environment.
read-write: Has read-write access to the environment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.UpdateEnvironmentMembershipRequest.UserArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the environment member whose settings you want to change.

member.name: T:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.UpdateEnvironmentMembershipResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateEnvironmentMembership operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.UpdateEnvironmentMembershipResponse.Membership
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Membership.
Information about the environment member whose settings were changed.

member.name: T:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.UpdateEnvironmentRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the UpdateEnvironment operation. Changes the settings of an existing AWS Cloud9 development environment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.UpdateEnvironmentRequest.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
Any new or replacement description for the environment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.UpdateEnvironmentRequest.EnvironmentId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EnvironmentId.
The ID of the environment to change settings.

member.name: P:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.UpdateEnvironmentRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
A replacement name for the environment.

member.name: T:Amazon.Cloud9.Model.UpdateEnvironmentResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateEnvironment operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Cloud9.AmazonCloud9Client
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing Cloud9
AWS Cloud9
AWS Cloud9 is a collection of tools that you can use to code, build, run, test, debug, and release software in the cloud.
For more information about AWS Cloud9, see the AWS Cloud9 User Guide.
AWS Cloud9 supports these operations:
CreateEnvironmentEC2: Creates an AWS Cloud9 development environment, launches an Amazon EC2 instance, and then connects from the instance to the environment.
CreateEnvironmentMembership: Adds an environment member to an environment.
DeleteEnvironment: Deletes an environment. If an Amazon EC2 instance is connected to the environment, also terminates the instance.
DeleteEnvironmentMembership: Deletes an environment member from an environment.
DescribeEnvironmentMemberships: Gets information about environment members for an environment.
DescribeEnvironments: Gets information about environments.
DescribeEnvironmentStatus: Gets status information for an environment.
ListEnvironments: Gets a list of environment identifiers.
UpdateEnvironment: Changes the settings of an existing environment.
UpdateEnvironmentMembership: Changes the settings of an existing environment member for an environment.

member.name: M:Amazon.Cloud9.AmazonCloud9Client.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonCloud9Client with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.Cloud9.AmazonCloud9Client.#ctor(Amazon.RegionEndpoint)
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonCloud9Client with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>
member.param: The region to connect.

member.name: M:Amazon.Cloud9.AmazonCloud9Client.CreateEnvironmentEC2Async(Amazon.Cloud9.Model.CreateEnvironmentEC2Request,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Creates an AWS Cloud9 development environment, launches an Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instance, and then connects from the instance to the environment.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateEnvironmentEC2 service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the CreateEnvironmentEC2 service method, as returned by Cloud9.
member.exception: The target resource cannot be found.
Too many service requests were made over the given time period.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for CreateEnvironmentEC2 Operation

member.name: T:Amazon.Cloud9.IAmazonCloud9
member.summary:
Interface for accessing Cloud9
AWS Cloud9
AWS Cloud9 is a collection of tools that you can use to code, build, run, test, debug, and release software in the cloud.
For more information about AWS Cloud9, see the AWS Cloud9 User Guide.
AWS Cloud9 supports these operations:
CreateEnvironmentEC2: Creates an AWS Cloud9 development environment, launches an Amazon EC2 instance, and then connects from the instance to the environment.
CreateEnvironmentMembership: Adds an environment member to an environment.
DeleteEnvironment: Deletes an environment. If an Amazon EC2 instance is connected to the environment, also terminates the instance.
DeleteEnvironmentMembership: Deletes an environment member from an environment.
DescribeEnvironmentMemberships: Gets information about environment members for an environment.
DescribeEnvironments: Gets information about environments.
DescribeEnvironmentStatus: Gets status information for an environment.
ListEnvironments: Gets a list of environment identifiers.
UpdateEnvironment: Changes the settings of an existing environment.
UpdateEnvironmentMembership: Changes the settings of an existing environment member for an environment.
